SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.ui

Class UIManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.ui.UIManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer
public class UIManager extends Object implements Observer
Manages UI elements like menus and buttons for the game level. Implements Observer to respond to changes in LevelParent or GameStateManager.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static UIManager getInstance(LevelParent levelParent, javafx.scene.Group menuLayer, double screenWidth, double screenHeight, javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Provides access to the Singleton instance of UIManager.
      Parameters:
      levelParent - The LevelParent instance.
      menuLayer - The menu layer.
      screenWidth - The screen width.
      screenHeight - The screen height.
      stage - The game stage.
      Returns:
      The Singleton instance of UIManager.

    • resetInstance

      public static void resetInstance()
      Resets the Singleton instance.

    • initializeUI

      public void initializeUI()
      Initializes the UI elements by adding them to the appropriate layers. Removes the existing pause button, clears menuLayer, and re-adds necessary components.

    • getPauseMenu

      public PauseMenu getPauseMenu()

      The PauseMenu instance.

      public javafx.scene.control.Button getPauseButton()
      Retrieves the Pause button.
      Returns:
      The Pause button.

    • update

      public void update(Object arg)
      Updates the game state based on the current game state. This method is called whenever the GameStateManager notifies its observers of a state change. It reacts to different game states by printing corresponding messages to the console.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer
      Parameters:
      arg - The updated game state, which should be an instance of GameStateManager.GameState. If the argument is not an instance of GameStateManager.GameState, this method does nothing.

    • cleanup

      public void cleanup()
      Cleans up UI elements for level transitions or restarts.
